metachat.pl.plot_group_communication_heatmapÔÉÅ

metachat.pl.plot_group_communication_heatmap(adata, database_name=None, group_name=None, metabolite_name=None, metapathway_name=None, customerlist_name=None, permutation_spatial=False, p_value_plot=True, p_value_cutoff=0.05, size_scale=300, cmap='green', palette=None, marker='s', x_order=None, y_order=None, figsize=(10, 10), ax=None, plot_savepath=None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Plot heatmap diagram for group-level MCC. The metabolic cell communication should have been computed by the function mc.tl.metabolic_communication(). The metabolic cell communication for some specific metabolite, metabolic pathway and customerlist should have been summarized by the function mc.tl.summary_communication(). The group-level metabolic cell communication flow should have been computed by the function mc.tl.communication_group() or mc.tl.communication_group_spatial().

Parameters:

  • adata (AnnData) ‚Äì The data matrix of shape n_obs √ó n_var. Rows correspond to cells or positions and columns to genes.

  • database_name (Optional[str]) ‚Äì Name of the Metabolite-Sensor interaction database.

  • group_name (Optional[str]) ‚Äì Group name of the cell annotation previously saved in adata.obs.

  • metabolite_name (Optional[str]) ‚Äì Name of a specific metabolite to detect response genes. For example, metabolite_name = ‚ÄòHMDB0000148‚Äô.

  • metapathway_name (Optional[str]) ‚Äì Name of a specific metabolic pathways to detect response genes. For example, metabolite_name = ‚ÄòAlanine, aspartate and glutamate metabolism‚Äô.

  • customerlist_name (Optional[str]) ‚Äì Name of a specific customerlist to detect response genes. For example, customerlist_name = ‚ÄòCustomerA‚Äô.

  • permutation_spatial (bool) ‚Äì Whether to use results from mc.tl.communication_group_spatial.

  • p_value_plot (bool) ‚Äì Whether to plot significant. if significant, show ‚Äú*‚Äù.

  • p_value_cutoff (float) ‚Äì Significance thresholds for Group-level MCC to plot.

  • size_scale (int) ‚Äì Control the size of points from values.

  • cmap (str) ‚Äì color map to plot communication intensity. Can be chose in ‚Äúgreen‚Äù, ‚Äúred‚Äù and ‚Äúblue‚Äù.

  • palette ‚Äì palette to plot communication intensity. Can be generated by ‚Äúsns.blend_palette‚Äù. If specify, the ‚Äúcmap‚Äù will not work.

  • marker (str) ‚Äì The marker shape show in heatmap. It‚Äôs the same parameter in ‚Äúax.scatter‚Äù.

  • x_order (Optional[list]) ‚Äì The order of sender cell groups show in the heatmap. e.g. x_order = [‚ÄúGroupA‚Äù, ‚ÄúGroupB‚Äù, ‚ÄúGroupC‚Äù]

  • y_order (Optional[list]) ‚Äì The order of receiver cell groups show in the heatmap. e.g. y_order = [‚ÄúGroupA‚Äù, ‚ÄúGroupB‚Äù, ‚ÄúGroupC‚Äù]

  • figsize (tuple) ‚Äì Fig size to plot the diagram.

  • plot_savepath (Optional[str]) ‚Äì Filename for saving the figure. Set the name to end with ‚Äò.pdf‚Äô or ‚Äòpng‚Äô to specify format.

  • ax (Optional[Axes]) ‚Äì An existing matplotlib ax (matplotlib.axis.Axis).

Returns:

ax ‚Äì The matplotlib ax object of the plot.

Return type:

matplotlib.axis.Axis
